description.narrative: By the end of 2015, the birth registration rate in 6 targeted district (BouakÃ©, Korhogo, Bondoukou,Man,San Pedro et OdiennÃ©) increases 5%., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, children are better protected against exclusion, violence, abuse, and exploitation through a strengthened child protection system.

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, the birth registration rate in 6 targeted district (Bouaké, Korhogo, Bondoukou,Man,San Pedro et Odienné) increases 5%.

description.narrative: The rate of birth registration in the legal delay increased by 13.5 per cent at national level and by 16 per cent in UNICEF CDI's targeted areas. 26,126 children not registered in the legal delay received birth certificates thanks to support from UNICEF CDI. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: Health workers trained on birth registration
